title: type on Turkish and German license plates
content:
Hi,  
Please help me to find the below of the numberplate fonts?  
Thanks for your help indead..

| --- | --- |

| [german.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/typophile.com/files/german.JPG) | 15.67 KB |

 [‹ Looking for a pulpy brush typeface as found on "Turok, Son of Stone" comic book](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/typophile.com/node/34585 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) w00tz! - Courier {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/typophile.com/node/34617 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Master

comments.content:
german ones are fe-schrift according to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FE-Schrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FE-Schrift "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FE-Schrift")

Line-to have fonts for these too: [http://www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Numberpla...](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Numberplate/ "http://www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Numberplate/")
Thanks for german font. But french font doesnt look what we are looking for..

I found german numberplate font.. Therefor I wanted to share with you..  
If you want You can download it..

DL : [http://www.1001fonts.com/font\_details.html?font\_id=1124](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/www.1001fonts.com/font_details.html?font_id=1124 "http://www.1001fonts.com/font\_details.html?font\_id=1124")

<cite>But french font doesnt look what we are looking for</cite>  
Maybe because it’s from turkey in my opinion ;)

BTW The very best digitisation for the FE-Schrift is [Fountain](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Fountain)’s [Sauerkrauto](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/ftn_sauerkrauto/). I’m not very impressed with the [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Lineto) version... :^/

BTW These are not “fonts” as you might know them, but alphabets specifically designed for the stamping machines that make those plates. So if they have not been digitised afterwards — which is what happened with the FE-Schriften — they don’t exist as digital fonts. It’s another world entirely.

I couldnt get information about the attached link.. would you please help me to find about the attached link..?

[http://img167.imageshack.us/img167/4484/ykselbaskce2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911194748/http:/img167.imageshack.us/img167/4484/ykselbaskce2.jpg "http://img167.imageshack.us/img167/4484/ykselbaskce2.jpg")
